last_post.content:
If you're dismissive of the impact an AI on the internet could have on the physical world, read about stuxnet first, and consider something much more clever than that. We already have an example of a worm designed by humans disabling Iran's nuclear program.

Human carelessness plus Giant-Component Theorems mean that an airgap will not save you. It already wasn't enough to keep Iran's centrifuges from being compromised.

title: The price of relevance is fluency - Anil Dash

last_post.content:
"Suddenly, even the most powerful people in society are forced to be fluent in the concerns of those with little power, if they want to hold on to the cultural relevance that thrust them into power in the first place. Being a comedian means having to say things that an audience finds funny; if an audience doesn't find old, hackneyed, abusive jokes funny anymore, then that comedian has to do more work. And what we find is, the comedians with the most privilege resent having to keep working for a living. Wasn't it good enough that they wrote that joke that some people found somewhat funny, some years ago? Why should they have to learn about current culture just to get paid to do comedy?"

Great article from five years ago by @anildash - https://anildash.com/2018/09/13/the-price-of-relevance-is-fluency/

title: Thieves’ Cant: The Secret Language Used By Criminals For Centuries

last_post.content:
Fun article on "thieves' cant", the slang code words used by rogues from the 16th to 19th centuries

https://www.ranker.com/list/history-of-cant-secret-language/genevieve-carlton

Apparently the source of several contemporary words including "phony", from "fáinne" (Irish for ring) or "fawney rig", a cheap ring that a con man would sell for an inflated value.

Some more fun examples:
"frummagemmed" - hanged
"chunk o'gin" - diamond
"priggers of cacklers" - hen snatchers
"cackling farts" - eggs

title: GitHub - raspberrypi/picoprobe

last_post.content:
Oh and for anyone else who runs into this, @aallan pointed me to the fact that the @Raspberry_Pi's "picoprobe" repo has a "debugprobe" branch that looks to be the source for the Debug Probe firmware. It's just another Pico-SDK project and builds with:
```
git clone https://github.com/raspberrypi/picoprobe
git fetch --all && git checkout debugprobe
git submodule update --init
mkdir build && cd build
cmake .. && make
cp picoprobe.uf2 /Volumes/RPI-RP2
```

The map region of the Lab is Downstairs.

And then one could use `when the location is in downstairs` in rule preambles or `if the player is in downstairs` as a conditional.
